channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2024010397
item.description:
Report E-2024010397

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Due to leaking 1-gallon plastic bottles of (UN3264) SikaColor®-420 Chemstain® CS1 black, 1-gallon of product released onto the exterior cardboard-box packaging of (24) boxes that were palletized and shrink-wrapped together. The leaking bottles are either due to human error or improper packaging. In total, (96) 1-gallon bottles were impacting with hazardous product and containerized into (6) 55DF's for hazardous waste disposal. The packaging, pallet, and PPE were neutralized using Kolorsafe and containerized into (4) 55DF's for non-hazardous waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024010344
item.description:
Report E-2024010344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill of (1) 330 gallon metal tote containing NALCO EC5407A (UN1993), which arrived at the terminal with a loose lid and spilled approximately 5 ounces onto the side of the tote and onto the floor of the trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, it was decided the spill could be cleaned in house with terminal issued PPE. The terminal cleaned the spill with absorbents and placed the contents into an 8 gallon metal drum and left in the waste area.

item.title: Report X-2024010470
item.description:
Report X-2024010470

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler noticed bottle was leaking and informed the manager immediately. Manager placed absorbent to stop leak from spreading, and then informed QA Admin to come collect the damaged hazmat. DescribePack: Bottom of bottle had a hole that caused hazmat liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent was placed to stop spread. Then leaky bottle was placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent to stop source of leak, and bag was placed inside a hazmat tote. Cleanup absorbent for spill on floor was also placed inside same hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2024010456
item.description:
Report X-2024010456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-31
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024010456 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET AND GIVING OFF A CAUSTIC ODOR. PACKAGE DAMAGED AT LOADSIDE, WRONGFULLY PLACED ON ITS SIDE. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM VENTED CAP. SPILL MINOR, ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM. 2. X-2024010457 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND GIVING OFF A CAUSTIC ODOR. PACKAGE DAMAGED DURING TRANSIT, INADEQUATE BLOCK AND BRACE. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM VENTED CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED AND NEUTRALIZED WITH PHNINE AND SMALL BROOM. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024010445
item.description:
Report X-2024010445

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: VENTURA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG FOUND AT QA WITH WET DAMAGE. INSPECTION FOUND CONTENTS INSIDE TO BE FLAMMABLE. SHUIPMENT SHIPPED INPROPERLY. IMPROPER CARTON. NO DOCUMENTATION. DescribePack: DAMAGE FOUND TO BE FROM USED CANNISTERS. LIDS CRACKED. CLOSURES TAPED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG TAKEN TO QA AND FOLLOWED UP WITH PACKING IN SALVAGE BIN.
